result.execSummary:
The defendant Cameron F. Ziehr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Stalking [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.32(2).
  • Violate/Harassment Restraining Order [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.125(7).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Kenosha County Clerk of Circuit Court

superMiscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Counseling shall specifically include:  Psychiatric/psychological.    Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  Submit to a DNA sample (unles previously provided) and pay surcharge.    
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May not have contact with Brittani J or her family, her residence or workplace, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Contact with child to be as agreed to by agent through 3rd party and any contact to be supervised - **unless otherwise approved by agent. **   AMENDED PER COURT ORDER

supervisions.notes: Court denies request for expunction consideration.

CONSECUTIVE to Ct 1.
Court denies request for expunction consideration.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) and pay surcharge.    
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May not have contact with Brittani J or her family, her residence or workplace, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.    May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Contact with child to be as agreed to by agent through  3rd party and any contact to be supervised  - **unless otherwise approved by agent. **   AMENDED PER COURT ORDER

Cts 1 & 2
Victim impact statement

Victim impact statement
Presentence incarceration credit.
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge
Extended Supervision Conditions-ordered by the court

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney C Lassiter.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On ct 1 the court imposes a total sentence of 4 years WSP; 2 years initial confinement w/credit for 132 days served; 2 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is not eligible for CIP/SAP; on ct 2 the court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 2 years w/conditions consecutive to ct 1; deft to pay $450 DNA surcharge; court denies request for expunction consideration.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney C Lassiter.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, cts 3, 4, 5 & 6 are dismissed and read in.  Deft pleads guilty to cts 1 & 2.  Court finds deft guilty of cts 1 & 2.  PSI ordered.  DNA sample ordered.  SEH 6/4/15 at 9am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney C Lassiter.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Victim present.  ADA Delgado states she opposes the defenses request for consideration of the mental health court; Atty Lassiter wants until next rotation to discuss offer w/deft.  FPT continued to 4/24/15 at 9am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney C Lassiter.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft pleads guilty to cts 1 & 2.  During plea colloquy Atty Lassiter states the deft wishes to withdraw his plea.  FPT continued to 3/31/15 at 1:15pm.  Bond continued.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Atty C Lassiter appeared on behalf of deft.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft in custody but not brought over.  Atty Lassiter's motion to modify bond.  Court denies motion for reasons set forth on the record.
for bond modification; filed by Atty C Lassiter.
No contact order while in custody rec'd back from KCJ signed by the deft.
